author: S P
text:
‘Team found no communal discrimination among students’

Four days after the death of a Class IV boy, P. Suriya, allegedly due to injuries sustained after his classmates beat him, a two-member team from the National Commission for Scheduled Castes, Chennai, visited the Panchayat Union Middle School in Kozhikalnatham near Tiruchengode on Wednesday and conducted an inquiry.

Members A. Eniyan and S. Lister, along with Tiruchengode Division DSP Sathyamoorthy, conducted inquiry with headmaster in-charge P. Shanmuga Sundaram, teachers and students. Sources said that the team found no communal discrimination among the students.

It would also be meeting the parents of Suriya. On February 29, the boy was allegedly beaten by two of his classmates at the school following a quarrel over a geometry box row. He was admitted to Salem Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital on March 4, where he died the next day.

The Tiruchengode rural police registered a case under SC/ST Act and arrested the two boys and sent them to an observatory home in Salem.
title: Boy’s death: SC panel holds inquiry at school
